location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Coll 1/44 'Aden. Changes in civil administration in the event of separation from India: rate of income tax'

physicalDescription.extent: The papers are arranged in chronological order from the rear to the front of the file

Foliation: the main foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the front cover with 1, and terminates at the inside back cover with 9; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.

mods.abstract: The file contains correspondence between the Aden Chief Commissioner (Bernard Reilly) and the India Office, regarding income tax arrangements following the transfer of the civil administration of Aden to the Colonial Office. It is suggested that Aden adopt the Indian Income-tax act, with any necessary modifications.
